lessonActivities.title: Introduction to Adverbs of Frequency
lessonActivities.content:
Adverbs of frequency tell us how often something happens.

We use them to talk about how many times we do activities in our daily lives.

Always (100%)
Usually (90%)
Often (70%)
Sometimes (50%)
Occasionally (30%)
Rarely (10%)
Never (0%)
examples: I always brush my teeth in the morning.
She usually walks to school.
They often play soccer after school.
We sometimes eat pizza for dinner.
I rarely forget my homework.
He never eats vegetables.

lessonActivities.title: Using Adverbs of Frequency in Sentences
lessonActivities.content:
We usually put adverbs of frequency:

  • Before the main verb
  • After the verb 'be'
examples: Before main verb: I always eat breakfast.
Before main verb: She never plays tennis.
After 'be': I am usually happy.
After 'be': They are often late.

lessonActivities.title: Time Expressions
lessonActivities.content: We can also use time expressions to say how often we do things:
examples: I brush my teeth twice a day.
We go to the park once a week.
They visit their grandparents every weekend.
She goes swimming three times a month.
We have art class on Fridays.

lessonActivities.title: Asking 'How Often' Questions
lessonActivities.content: To ask about frequency, we use the question How often...?
examples: How often do you brush your teeth?
How often does she go to the library?
How often do they visit their grandmother?
How often do we have math class?

lessonActivities.title: Review and Practice
lessonActivities.content:
Let's remember the main adverbs of frequency and their meanings:

AdverbMeaning
Always100% of the time
UsuallyAbout 80-90% of the time
OftenAbout 70% of the time
SometimesAbout 50% of the time
OccasionallyAbout 30% of the time
RarelyAbout 10% of the time
Never0% of the time
examples: Question: How often do you go to the movies?
Answer: I sometimes go to the movies.
Question: How often does he play basketball?
Answer: He plays basketball twice a week.

writingActivities.question: How often do you read comics?
writingActivities.hint: Think about how many times in a week or month you read books.

writingActivities.question: How often does your family eat dinner together?
writingActivities.hint: Think about your family dinners. Do you eat together every day or only on special occasions?

writingActivities.question: How often do you play sports?
writingActivities.hint: Do you play sports regularly or only occasionally?

writingActivities.question: How often do you brush your teeth?
writingActivities.hint: Think about your morning and night routine.
sentenceStarters: The dentist says we should __ brush __.

writingActivities.question: How often do you visit your grandparents?
writingActivities.hint: Think about special visits or regular meetings.
